newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: CRICKET-ENGLAND SLUMP TO 156 ALL OUT.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-ENGLAND SLUMP TO 156 ALL OUT.

text.p: England for a paltry 156 on Friday then reached 35 for one in reply.

England's last pair of John Crawley and Phil Tufnell held Zimbabwe up for 10 overs on the second day of the second test before Tufnell was out to a short ball from Heath Streak that richocheted from his midriff on to the stumps.
Crawley was left high and dry on 47 not out from 172 balls. Streak finished with four for 43 and Guy Whittall took a career-best four for 18.
Mark Dekker was an early victim in the Zimbabwe reply, edging an Alan Mullally out-swinger through to the wicketkeeper when he had made two.
Mullally and Darren Gough were hostile with the new ball, but Zimbabwe's second wicket pair of Alistair Campbell (15) and Grant Flower (16) held out until the lunch.
